definition: to save from damage/to preserve/to maintain/to keep in good repair/(Tw) security guard
Bulgaria/Bulgarian/abbr. for 保加利亞|保加利亚[Bao3 jia1 li4 ya4]
to defend/to protect/to keep/to guarantee/to ensure/civil administration unit in the baojia 保甲[bao3 jia3] system (old)
all/whole/entire/every/complete
surname Quan
(Tw) security guard

sentences.english: He drives his own car everywhere and does not have a driver or security people around him.
sentences.chinese: 他都自己開車出門，也沒有請司機或保全人員跟着他。

sentences.english: He keepeth all his bones: not one of them is broken.
sentences.chinese: 又保全他一身的骨頭，連一根也不折斷。

sentences.english: Our goods are very valuable, so Iwant insure against all risks.
sentences.chinese: 我們的商品很寶貴，所以我想保全險。

sentences.english: The soldier didn't desert his comrade-in-arms so as to sav his own life.
sentences.chinese: 這個士兵沒有爲了保全自己的性命而不顧戰友。

sentences.english: The security fuard launched himself and took him down to the ground.
sentences.chinese: 這位保全向那個搶匪猛撲過去，把他壓倒在地上。

sentences.english: This is just a step of comrade preserved locust tree.
sentences.chinese: 這只是保全槐樹同志的其中一步。

sentences.english: Mercy and truth preserve the king: and his throne is upholden by mercy.
sentences.chinese: 王因仁慈和誠實，得以保全他的國位，也因仁慈立穩。

sentences.english: The capital maintenance means the perfection of the capital.
sentences.chinese: 資本保全是指資本的完整無缺。

sentences.english: He finally worked out a face-saving arrangement.
sentences.chinese: 他終於想出了一個保全面子的辦法。

sentences.english: The humiliation of drill bar Lord Onizuka is the crotch, save the lives of wuchang.
sentences.chinese: 槓爺羞辱的鑽了鬼冢正的褲襠，保全那五常的性命。

sentences.english: "I have seen God face to face, and my life is preserved" (Gen. xxxii. 30).
sentences.chinese: 我面對面見了上帝，我的性命仍得保全。

sentences.english: They argued in effect better that one should die so that three could survive.
sentences.chinese: 辯稱“犧牲一人保全三人“是更好的結果。

sentences.english: He%26rsquo; s the kind of person who do anything to save his own skin.
sentences.chinese: 他是那種爲了保全自己什麼都肯做的人。

sentences.english: Cutting off a "minor" part may help to save the colony as a whole.
sentences.chinese: 捨棄“不重要”的部分來保全整個羣體。

sentences.english: It is possible to popularize generally the technique.
sentences.chinese: 這項補栽保全苗技術，可普遍推廣。

sentences.english: The compromise was a face-saver for all concerned.
sentences.chinese: 折衷是一個能讓所有相關人士保全顏面的辦法。

definition: to preserve/to save
to defend oneself/self-defense/self-preservation
life
to be saved from/to be spared (something)
life/to survive/to save a life/to scrape a living
to avoid suffering/to avoid meeting (a fatal accident)/spared
safety and danger/safety
to go all out for sth at risk of one's life
to save one's life/to survive
to bear humiliation to save one's skin (idiom)
to come to the aid of/to save/to rescue from danger/to relieve
to drift and live without purpose (idiom); to drag out an ignoble existence
to get away/to escape (from obligations)/to free oneself/to disengage
to rely on sb for protection
to rely on help from sb
to act with urgency/to buy time
